main event: A single object, generally white with a reddish tint, was observed to drift to the south over Mira Loma, California on April 9, 1955.
interesting points: The object had no noise or visible vapor trail or exhaust.
The sighting lasted for approximately 50 minutes.
The sighting was investigated by the 4602d AISS and checks with weather stations in the area indicate the object was likely a weather balloon.
No photographs of the object were taken.
The report concludes the object was probably a weather balloon.
